items.task: Review OSPF advanced features: LSA types, area types (stub, totally stubby, NSSA), route summarization, virtual links, authentication.
Deep dive into BGP: attributes (path selection), route reflectors, confederations, communities, regular expressions, troubleshooting.
Master EIGRP advanced concepts: DUAL algorithm, unequal-cost load balancing, summarization, stub routing, authentication.
Study STP variations and best practices: RSTP, MSTP, BPDU Guard, Root Guard, Loop Guard, PortFast.
Understand VLAN Trunking Protocol (VTP) modes, pruning, and security considerations.
Review EtherChannel (LACP/PAgP) configuration, load balancing methods, and troubleshooting.
Familiarize with Cisco IOS/IOS-XE/NX-OS/ASA CLI commands and common troubleshooting tools (ping, traceroute, show commands, debug).
Explore Network Security: ACLs (standard, extended, named), VPNs (IPsec, SSL), NAT/PAT, Firewall concepts (stateful vs. stateless).
Understand Cisco ASA/FTD firewall features, contexts, and common configurations.
Study Cisco ISE (Identity Services Engine) core functionalities: authentication, authorization, accounting (AAA), BYOD, guest access.
Review Wireless LAN Controller (WLC) architecture, AP modes, roaming, and security (WPA2-Enterprise, 802.1X).
Investigate Data Center Networking: Cisco Nexus OS features, Virtual Port-Channels (vPC), FabricPath/TRILL concepts.
Learn about Cisco ACI (Application Centric Infrastructure): concepts (EPG, BD, VRF, Bridge Domain), policy model, fabric access.
Understand SD-WAN (Viptela/Meraki/Catalyst SD-WAN) architecture, components, and policy creation.
Explore Network Automation and Programmability: Python scripting for network tasks, Ansible playbooks, NETCONF/RESTCONF APIs.
Practice network design scenarios: campus, data center, WAN, security design principles.
Review QoS mechanisms: classification, marking, queuing, policing, shaping, congestion management.
Prepare for common troubleshooting scenarios for routing, switching, and security issues.
Research Cisco's current technology trends and strategic initiatives (e.g., intent-based networking, SASE).
Prepare answers for behavioral and situational interview questions (e.g., 'Tell me about a challenging project', 'How do you handle conflict?').
Conduct mock interviews focusing on advanced technical and problem-solving questions.
